types.name: String
types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: FixedProductTaxDisplaySettings
types.description: Lists display settings for the Fixed Product Tax.

enumValues.name: INCLUDE_FPT_WITHOUT_DETAILS
enumValues.description: The displayed price includes the FPT amount without displaying the `ProductPrice.fixed_product_taxes` values. This value corresponds to 'Including FPT only'.

enumValues.name: INCLUDE_FPT_WITH_DETAILS
enumValues.description: The displayed price includes the FPT amount while displaying the values of `ProductPrice.fixed_product_taxes` separately. This value corresponds to 'Including FPT and FPT description'.

enumValues.name: EXCLUDE_FPT_AND_INCLUDE_WITH_DETAILS
enumValues.description: The displayed price does not include the FPT amount. The values of `ProductPrice.fixed_product_taxes` and the price including the FPT are displayed separately. This value corresponds to 'Excluding FPT, Including FPT description and final price.'

enumValues.name: EXCLUDE_FPT_WITHOUT_DETAILS
enumValues.description: The displayed price does not include the FPT amount. The values from `ProductPrice.fixed_product_taxes` are not displayed. This value corresponds to 'Excluding FPT'.

enumValues.name: FPT_DISABLED
enumValues.description: The FPT feature is not enabled. You can omit `ProductPrice.fixed_product_taxes` from your query.

types.name: Int
types.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric
values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: ID
types.description:
The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to
refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON
response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer
(such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

inputFields.description: Filter by the part of the URL that identifies the category.

types.name: FilterEqualTypeInput
types.description: Defines a filter that matches the input exactly.

inputFields.name: eq
inputFields.description: Use this attribute to exactly match the specified string. For example, to filter on a specific category ID, specify a value such as `5`.

inputFields.name: in
inputFields.description: Use this attribute to filter on an array of values. For example, to filter on category IDs 4, 5, and 6, specify a value of `["4", "5", "6"]`.

types.name: FilterMatchTypeInput
types.description: Defines a filter that performs a fuzzy search.

inputFields.name: match
inputFields.description: Use this attribute to exactly match the specified string. For example, to filter on a specific SKU, specify a value such as `24-MB01`.

types.name: PayflowProTokenInput
types.description: Contains input required to fetch payment token information for the Payflow Pro and Payments Pro payment methods.

inputFields.name: cart_id
inputFields.description: The unique ID that identifies the shopper's cart.

inputFields.name: urls
inputFields.description: A set of relative URLs that PayPal uses for callback.

types.name: PayflowProUrlInput
types.description: Contains a set of relative URLs that PayPal uses in response to various actions during the authorization process. Magento prepends the base URL to this value to create a full URL. For example, if the full URL is https://www.example.com/path/to/page.html, the relative URL is path/to/page.html. Use this input for the Payflow Pro and Payment Pro payment methods.

inputFields.name: cancel_url
inputFields.description: The relative URL of the page that PayPal redirects to when the buyer cancels the transaction in order to choose a different payment method. If the full URL to this page is https://www.example.com/paypal/action/cancel.html, the relative URL is paypal/action/cancel.html.

inputFields.name: error_url
inputFields.description: The relative URL of the transaction error page that PayPal redirects to upon payment error. If the full URL to this page is https://www.example.com/paypal/action/error.html, the relative URL is paypal/action/error.html.

inputFields.name: return_url
inputFields.description: The relative URL of the final confirmation page that PayPal redirects to upon payment success. If the full URL to this page is https://www.example.com/paypal/action/return.html, the relative URL is paypal/action/return.html.

types.name: CreatePayflowProTokenOutput
types.description: Contains the secure information used to authorize transaction. Applies to Payflow Pro and Payments Pro payment methods.

fields.name: response_message
fields.description: The RESPMSG returned by PayPal. If the `result` is `0`, then `response_message` is `Approved`.

fields.name: result
fields.description: A non-zero value if any errors occurred.

fields.name: result_code
fields.description: The RESULT returned by PayPal. A value of `0` indicates the transaction was approved.

fields.name: secure_token
fields.description: A secure token generated by PayPal.

fields.name: secure_token_id
fields.description: A secure token ID generated by PayPal.

inputFields.name: urls
inputFields.description: A set of relative URLs that PayPal uses in response to various actions during the authorization process.

inputFields.name: use_paypal_credit
inputFields.description: Indicates whether the buyer clicked the PayPal credit button. The default value is false.

types.name: PaypalExpressUrlsInput
types.description: Contains a set of relative URLs that PayPal uses in response to various actions during the authorization process. Magento prepends the base URL to this value to create a full URL. For example, if the full URL is https://www.example.com/path/to/page.html, the relative URL is path/to/page.html. Use this input for Express Checkout and Payments Standard payment methods.

inputFields.name: cancel_url
inputFields.description: The relative URL of the page that PayPal redirects to when the buyer cancels the transaction in order to choose a different payment method. If the full URL to this page is https://www.example.com/paypal/action/cancel.html, the relative URL is paypal/action/cancel.html.

inputFields.name: pending_url
inputFields.description: The relative URL of the page that PayPal redirects to when the payment has been put on hold for additional review. This condition mostly applies to ACH transactions, and is not applicable to most PayPal solutions. If the full URL to this page is https://www.example.com/paypal/action/success_pending.html, the relative URL is paypal/action/success_pending.html.

inputFields.name: return_url
inputFields.description: The relative URL of the final confirmation page that PayPal redirects to upon payment success. If the full URL to this page is https://www.example.com/paypal/action/return.html, the relative URL is paypal/action/return.html.

inputFields.name: success_url
inputFields.description: The relative URL of the order confirmation page that PayPal redirects to when the payment is successful and additional confirmation is not needed. Not applicable to most PayPal solutions. If the full URL to this page is https://www.example.com/paypal/action/success.html, the relative URL is paypal/action/success.html.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.
